trans-unit.source: Install and configure PostgreSQL on a Microsoft Azure virtual machine running Linux | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Install and configure PostgreSQL on a Microsoft Azure virtual machine running Linux | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to install and configure PostgreSQL on a Linux virtual machine in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to install and configure PostgreSQL on a Linux virtual machine in Azure.

trans-unit.source: PostgreSQL is an advanced open-source database similar to Oracle and DB2.
trans-unit.target: PostgreSQL is an advanced open-source database similar to Oracle and DB2.

trans-unit.source: It includes enterprise-ready features such as full ACID compliance, reliable transactional processing, and multi-version concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: It includes enterprise-ready features such as full ACID compliance, reliable transactional processing, and multi-version concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: It also supports standards such as ANSI SQL and SQL/MED (including foreign data wrappers for Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB, and many others).
trans-unit.target: It also supports standards such as ANSI SQL and SQL/MED (including foreign data wrappers for Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB, and many others).

trans-unit.source: It is highly extensible with support for over 12 procedural languages, GIN and GiST indexes, spatial data support, and multiple NoSQL-like features for JSON or key-value-based applications.
trans-unit.target: It is highly extensible with support for over 12 procedural languages, GIN and GiST indexes, spatial data support, and multiple NoSQL-like features for JSON or key-value-based applications.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how to install and configure PostgreSQL on an Azure virtual machine running Linux.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how to install and configure PostgreSQL on an Azure virtual machine running Linux.

trans-unit.source: You must already have an Azure virtual machine running Linux in order to complete this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You must already have an Azure virtual machine running Linux in order to complete this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: To create and set up a Linux VM before proceeding, see the <linkText>Azure Linux VM tutorial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To create and set up a Linux VM before proceeding, see the <linkText>Azure Linux VM tutorial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this case, use port 1999 as the PostgreSQL port.
trans-unit.target: In this case, use port 1999 as the PostgreSQL port.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the Linux VM you created via PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the Linux VM you created via PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: If this is the first time you're using an Azure Linux VM, see <linkText>How to Use SSH with Linux on Azure</linkText><title></title> to learn how to use PuTTY to connect to a Linux VM.
trans-unit.target: If this is the first time you're using an Azure Linux VM, see <linkText>How to Use SSH with Linux on Azure</linkText><title></title> to learn how to use PuTTY to connect to a Linux VM.

trans-unit.source: Create a non-root user and modify that user’s profile.
trans-unit.target: Create a non-root user and modify that user’s profile.

trans-unit.source: Then, switch to this new user (called postgres in our example):
trans-unit.target: Then, switch to this new user (called postgres in our example):

trans-unit.source: For security reasons, PostgreSQL uses a non-root user to initialize, start, or shut down the database.
trans-unit.target: For security reasons, PostgreSQL uses a non-root user to initialize, start, or shut down the database.

trans-unit.source: Modify two variables in the /etc/init.d/postgresql file.
trans-unit.target: Modify two variables in the /etc/init.d/postgresql file.

trans-unit.source: The prefix is set to the installation path of PostgreSQL: /opt/pgsql.
trans-unit.target: The prefix is set to the installation path of PostgreSQL: /opt/pgsql.

trans-unit.source: PGDATA is set to the data storage path of PostgreSQL: /opt/pgsql_data.
trans-unit.target: PGDATA is set to the data storage path of PostgreSQL: /opt/pgsql_data.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have connected to the database, you can create tables in it.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have connected to the database, you can create tables in it.

trans-unit.source: For example, create a new example Postgres table by using the following command:
trans-unit.target: For example, create a new example Postgres table by using the following command:

trans-unit.source: You have now set up a four-column table with the following column names and restrictions:
trans-unit.target: You have now set up a four-column table with the following column names and restrictions:

trans-unit.source: The “name” column has been limited by the VARCHAR command to be under 20 characters long.
trans-unit.target: The “name” column has been limited by the VARCHAR command to be under 20 characters long.

trans-unit.source: The “food” column indicates the food item that each person will bring.
trans-unit.target: The “food” column indicates the food item that each person will bring.

trans-unit.source: VARCHAR limits this text to be under 30 characters.
trans-unit.target: VARCHAR limits this text to be under 30 characters.

trans-unit.source: The “confirmed” column records whether the person has RSVP’d to the potluck.
trans-unit.target: The “confirmed” column records whether the person has RSVP’d to the potluck.

trans-unit.source: The acceptable values are "Y" and "N".
trans-unit.target: The acceptable values are "Y" and "N".

trans-unit.source: The “date” column shows when they signed up for the event.
trans-unit.target: The “date” column shows when they signed up for the event.

trans-unit.source: Postgres requires that dates be written as yyyy-mm-dd.
trans-unit.target: Postgres requires that dates be written as yyyy-mm-dd.

trans-unit.source: You should see the following if your table has been successfully created:
trans-unit.target: You should see the following if your table has been successfully created:

trans-unit.source: Now that you have completed the installation of PostgreSQL in an Azure Linux VM, you can enjoy using it in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have completed the installation of PostgreSQL in an Azure Linux VM, you can enjoy using it in Azure.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about PostgreSQL, visit the <linkText>PostgreSQL website</linkText><title></title>.
